info.title: Kentik Alert Mitigations API
info.description:
# Overview
The Alert Mitigations API provides programmatic access to Kentik's capabilities of configuring and managing network infrastructure mitigations that are triggered automatically based on alerts or manually to prevent network attacks.

parameters.name: pagination.limit
parameters.description: limit is how many items to return at most.

parameters.name: pagination.offset
parameters.description: offset is the offset into the list of items.

parameters.name: pagination.includeTotalCount
parameters.description:
include_total_count is a flag to enforce API service to include the total count of items in the response,
which in some cases may be very expensive to fetch.

parameters.name: filters.mitigationIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the mitigations to list.

parameters.name: filters.alarmIds
parameters.description: The alarm IDs the mitigations are associated with.

parameters.name: filters.states
parameters.description: The states of the mitigations to filter by.

parameters.name: filters.platformIds
parameters.description: The mitigation platform IDs the mitigations are associated with.

parameters.name: filters.methodIds
parameters.description: The mitigation method IDs the mitigations are associated with.

parameters.name: filters.ipCidrs
parameters.description: The IP/CIDR ranges the mitigations target.

parameters.name: filters.ipCidrPattern
parameters.description: The IP/CIDR pattern to filter mitigations by.

parameters.name: filters.types
parameters.description:
The types of mitigations to filter by.

 - MITIGATION_TYPE_MANUAL: Manual mitigation
 - MITIGATION_TYPE_AUTO: Automatic mitigation

post.description: Performs an action on one or more mitigations.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to perform on the mitigations.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The ID of the mitigation to get.

get.description: Returns available actions for a specific mitigation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the mitigation to get available actions for.

availableActions.description: The available actions from this state.

limit.title: limit is how many items to return at most

offset.title: offset is the offset into the list of items

includeTotalCount.title:
include_total_count is a flag to enforce API service to include the total count of items in the response,
which in some cases may be very expensive to fetch

totalCount.description:
total_count is the total number of items in the list.
It may be provided optionally if include_total_count is set to false.
It will be provided always if include_total_count is set to true.

hasMoreResults.title:
has_more_results is a flag to indicate if there are more results to fetch
It may be provided instead of total_count if include_total_count is set to false and it would be very expensive to fetch the total count

v202501FlowspecMatch.description:
FlowspecMatch represents the traffic filtering criteria encoded
as Flow Specification NLRI as per RFC 8955:
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8955#name-dissemination-of-ipv4-flow-
and other related documents.
